summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York regarding a draft Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request to France concerning a witness and Jean-Luc Brunel. It indicates coordination with the Paris Prosecutor's Office and a willingness for reciprocal assistance.

persons.name: Brunel
persons.context: The email discusses a draft MLAT request to France regarding a witness and mentions that the DOJ Attaché met with the Paris Prosecutor's Office about Brunel.

events.title: Draft MLAT Request to France
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney circulates a draft Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty request to France regarding a witness and Jean-Luc Brunel.

events.title: DOJ Attaché Meeting with Paris Prosecutor's Office
events.description: The DOJ Attaché met with the Paris Prosecutor's Office about Jean-Luc Brunel, indicating a willingness to assist based on an MLAT request and reciprocal sharing.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Department of Justice is preparing an MLAT request to France regarding a witness and Jean-Luc Brunel.
The DOJ Attaché has already met with the Paris Prosecutor's Office about Brunel, and French authorities indicated willingness to assist on the basis of an MLAT request.
French authorities emphasized that assistance should be reciprocal in nature.

The correspondence originates from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, indicating ongoing international coordination in the Epstein-related investigations in early 2021.
